meanings.sent1: The kids were so jivey during the school play, jumping and cheering.
meanings.sent2: The party was jivey with music, laughter, and dancing.
meanings.sent3: The jivey puppy chased its tail in circles, full of playful energy.
meanings.sent4: Her jivey spirit was like a spark igniting the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The jivey colors of the sunset painted the sky in vibrant hues.

meanings.sent1: He tried to jivey his way out of trouble by making up excuses.
meanings.sent2: The con artist would often jivey unsuspecting victims with false promises.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to jivey the audience into believing the coin disappeared.
meanings.sent4: Her smile could jivey anyone into thinking she was happy, hiding her true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The mirage in the desert jiveyed the travelers into thinking they saw an oasis.

meanings.sent1: Don't listen to his jivey, he's just trying to confuse you.
meanings.sent2: The politician's speech was full of jivey, promising things he couldn't deliver.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jivey had the audience laughing at the absurdity of his jokes.
meanings.sent4: Her excuses were like jivey, unraveling under scrutiny.
meanings.sent5: The jivey of the gossip was like a tangled web of half-truths and exaggerations.
